venue.name: The Blackstone River and Canal Heritage State Park

item.description:
Come see how Maple Syrup is made, starting with the maple trees!

This free demonstration will include:

  • Indoor talk & demonstration about the art and science of sugar-making
  • A visit to the sampling table to try a bit of maple sap before it becomes syrup and other maple goodies.
  • A walk to see the maple tapping and collecting process. Watch as a tree is tapped and maybe even lend a hand with a drill. Help carry buckets of sap back to the sugar house.
  • A visit to our new sugar house to see how sap is made into syrup.

Be sure to leave time for parking - it can be crowded. First sugaring tour is at 11:00 am. We will either do the sugaring tour or walk first depending on availability of the tour.

Please note:  It's generally snowy or muddy out in the fields and woods where our maple trees are located. You'll appreciate your gloves, hats, and, most especially, your boots!

For additional information and directions vist: http://www.blackstonevalleysugaring.org/

My cell if you have trouble finding us or are running late: 508-415-0590
item.name: Maple Sugar Days & Blackstone River Canal Walk
